Currently the 'Last Column' option in {viewxls} takes a numeric value, whereas in Excel document by default uses alphabets to designate columns. A value of '0' is Column A, '1' is Column B, etc...

This field allows the user to put in non-numeric values without error, which results no effect. This causes a bit of confusion if the user is not paying attention to the text below the field explaining the numeric value requirement.

Two ways we can improve this feature:
* Keep current functionality, but prevent users from inputting non-numeric values
OR, better yet...
* Allow users to input letters as they appear in Excel

fields.description:
When using the JIRA issues macro on a confluence page to display issues with custom datetime fields, the date is shown, but not the time.

# Create a custom Date Time field in JIRA
# Add some issues that enter a value in the custom field
# Add the custom field to the search results in JIRA
# View a search that shows the issues and the custom field

# Link Confluence and JIRA together
# Create a page and add the JIRA Issues Macro
# Enter the name of the custom field in columns

(i) This does not only affects custom fields with date/time picker type but built-in fields too.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26366].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability that affect Confluence instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers). XSS vulnerabilities allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. All supported versions of Confluence are affected.

More details are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+2012-09-11

*Patch for versions older than 4.1.9*

Attached is a patch that will fix this XSS issue for versions of Confluence older than 4.1.9. This patch has also been tested against Confluence 3.5.16, and should work for all Confluence 3.5.x releases. However, as with any patch, this should be tested thoroughly first, and initially monitored after being installed in production.

To install:

1. Download the attached zip file
2. Shutdown Confluence
3. Move the zip file <installation-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes
4. Extract the zip file
5. Verify that the file <installation-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/servlet/ConfluenceVelocityServlet.class exists
6. Restart Confluence for the change to take effect

You can read more about applying patches here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Patched+Class+Files
fields.summary: Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability

We occasionally edit our Wiki pages in bulk by having each page open on separate browser tabs, editing and then scrolling through them then using shortcut Ctrl+S to save. 

We remove notifications to avoid our users being bombarded by notification emails however this is a laborious manual task as we have to manually deselect the notify watchers tab for each page. 

Any chance of a keyboard shortcut to toggle notify watchers? This would infinitely speed up our processes and avoid needlessly/mistakenly spamming watchers.

Big fan of the shortcuts - this would be the icing on the cake.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Type an asterisk '*' followed by a space and a text 'Test' to create a bulleted list
# Press enter (this will create a second bullet)
# Press enter again (this will change the formatting from bulleted list to paragraph)
# Type 'h1.' followed by a space and a text 'Heading'
#* In Confluence 4.1 using IE 8.0.6, the cursor will point to the previous bullet and the text in that bullet becomes a heading
#* In Confluence 4.1 using IE 8.0.7 and Confluence 4.2 using any IE8, the text does not render as heading

*Workarounds*
# Create two empty lines and then type a heading autoformatting (h1.) as usual. After that, delete the previous empty line manually (works for Confluence 4.1 and 4.2)
# After a bulleted list, type enter to form a new line. And then change the style formatting manually in the Editor by clicking "Paragraph" and then change it to "Heading 1" (this workaround only works for Confluence 4.2.x)
fields.summary: Heading autoformatting does not work properly if followed by bullets in IE8

This is true even when reciprocal URL's are used between Confluence and Jira (ie HTTP to/from the tomcats themselves).

    JiraIssues Macro fails to pull in and display issues
    Jira Gadgets fail to operate (they assume 'anonymous which usually results in no data)
fields.summary: If OAuth configures successfully without Error level messages then functions using OAuth should complete without problems.

fields.description:
See [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/72648/addattachment-json]

The addAttachment method in the Remote API accepted a byte array value containing the attachment data.  In the current implementation of the JSON-RPC plugin, there is no way to express this parameter in a way that produces valid JSON, making this method unreachable.
fields.summary: the addAttachment remote method cannot be called using the JSON-RPC API
